page.title: 14Trinity Honorary System
page.content: We interviewed Mr. Brian Richardson who has been in the Trinity Honorary Police system for three and a half years. The police deal with law and order in the Parish. In Trinity there are twenty one officers: three{Centeniers, a senior centenier, five{Vingteniers,} and twelve{Constable's Officers. }The officers are headed by{the Constable of the{Parish.} The centeniers are the only people who can charge a person for court. The senior centenier is called the Chef De Police. There are five vingtaines in Trinity. The vingtenier's job is to assist the centeniers. The constable organises the officers. The church wardens are also honorary people. All people who work in the honorary system do so without being paid.
